description.value:
Scholars, missionaries, and preachers. Clerics use magic learned through deep devotion and study of a faith. They are commonly, but not always, skilled healers.

This version of the cleric class is designed to be simple. It emphasizes the choice of divine domain and grants powerful late-game domain features earlier. Existing 5e subclasses will all work mechanically with this form of the cleric class. Click @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.VLxJ80DY7q7hkXU7.JournalEntryPage.QjLATbZ1uI3tAwjs#cleric]{here} for a summary of changes.

Level 1 Cleric

When you create a level 1 Cleric, you will need to manually add your ability scores. You will gain the rest of the following automatically:

Recommended Ability Scores

You can take one of these recommended ability score arrays, or you can roll or assign them yourself. You can switch any two ability scores, but you do not add any further bonuses (they're already included).

&reference[Strength]: 14 &reference[Dexterity]: 10 &reference[Constitution]: 16 &reference[Intelligence]: 8 &reference[Wisdom]: 16 &reference[Charisma]: 10

or

Strength: 8 Dexterity: 14 Constitution: 14 Intelligence: 12 Wisdom: 16 Charisma: 12

Feat

You gain a level 1 @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.lGAvinVvDjAXzQ1Q]{feat} of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.â€‹

Hit Points

Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + Constitution Modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d8 per cleric level

Proficiencies

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1]{Armor}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.4ZoOlPhNDk46Vvnr]{Light Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.pHlopVD36uBfquJF]{Medium Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.X44Pl3A47cBj6yUt]{Heavy Armor}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}
Saving Throws: &Reference[Wisdom], &Reference[Charisma]
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.rv19GFzEa0nMTuAF]{Skills}: two of: &reference[History], &reference[Insight], &reference[Intimidation], &reference[Medicine], &reference[Persuasion], and &reference[Religion]

Items

You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

  • a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.ntmAbPMerRRj93Jy]{mace} -OR- one @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.MzJ8wA3QJOZDJ1El]{martial melee weapon}
  • @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.sgcCg8pGXKBu3f4S]{chain mail} -OR- @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.QhHQy7whejLOVFf8]{scale mail} -OR- @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.jSi9ralAm7FzUQbH]{padded armor}
  • a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.wPcrbw6GTNb9ZYvp]{light crossbow} and 20 bolts -OR- any @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}
  • @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.AENiTUeluTRiFzRz]{large shield}
  • a holy symbol
  • a priest's pack -OR- an explorer's pack

Multiclass Characters

Instead of leveling up in your original class, you can take a cleric level when you level up. When you do, you gain only a portion of what first level clerics gain.

Multiclassing Ability Score Requirements

Taking levels in several classes requires exceptional ability. You must meet the multiclassing ability score requirements for both your original class and the class you are multiclassing into.

For cleric you must have:

  • Wisdom: 14

Hit Points

Per Level: 1d8 (or 5) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d8 per cleric level

Proficiencies

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1]{Armor}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.4ZoOlPhNDk46Vvnr]{Light Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.pHlopVD36uBfquJF]{Medium Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.X44Pl3A47cBj6yUt]{Heavy Armor}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}
Saving Throws: &Reference[Wisdom], &Reference[Charisma]

advancement.title: Item
advancement.hint: a mace -OR- one Melee Martial Weapon (if proficient)

advancement.title: Item
advancement.hint: chain mail -OR- scale mail -OR- padded armor

advancement.title: Item
advancement.hint: a light crossbow and 20 bolts -OR- any Simple Weapon

advancement.title: Superior Ability
advancement.hint: You increase one ability score of your choice by 2, to a maximum of 22.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint:
At this level and every level you gain an ability score improvement, you also gain a feat of your choice. You are eligible for general feats and cleric feats by default.
                        You may be eligible for other feats, which you can drag from the appropriate compendium into this box below.
                        
                        Some feats have additional prerequisites. Check the description of a feat before choosing it.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint: You gain a level 1 feat of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.â€‹

advancement.title: Divine Domain
advancement.hint:
Every cleric's religion has at least one associated Domain. Your choice of Domain represents the tenets of your organized faith. While most faiths in 5e settings revolve around a a single deity, your domain could represent a pantheon, a faith that lacks a deity, or even a religious-like devotion to an ideal or organization. Your domain grants you features at level 3, 6, 10, and 14, also listed below. At this level, your choice of Divine Domain gives you access to extra spells. If you're using a Divine Domain published somewhere other than Elkan 5e, you gain its level 1 and 2 features at level 3.
    
    Divine Domains published elsewhere are compatible with this version of the cleric class. For help converting a subclass to function with Elkan 5e, see the Elkan 5e Rules Compendium -> Help.
